pycotech.utils.build_pico_stream(rows: List[List[Union[str, float]]]) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]Â¶

Packs a list of channel-by-channel data-samples into a pico-stream dataframe format, where each row is a temperature measurement from a single PicoLogger acquisition channel.

Parameters

rows â€“ list of records. Each record should be a list with the acquisition channel name and associated measurement value.

Returns

input data packed into a pico-stream dataframe.

index: None (enumeration of entries) columns: channel, temp

Extracts metadata information from a .PLW file.

fn â€“ path to the .PLW file to parse.

Returns

metadata associated with data contained in the .PLW file, as a single string.

pycotech.utils.from_pico_stream(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]Â¶

Packs a channel-by-channel data-stream into a PicoLog PLW Player data dataframe, where each row has temperature measurements across all PicoLogger acquisition channels.

For an input data-stream of length num_samples x num_channels, the output dataframe will have shape (num_samples, num_channels).

Parameters

  • df â€“ PicoLog PLW Player data-stream, where each row has a

  • measurement from a single PicoLogger acquisition channel. (temperature) â€“

Returns

Equivalent packed-dataframe, where each row has temperature measurements across all PicoLogger acquisition channels.

index: None (enumeration of entries) columns: <channel_name>, â€¦ x num_channels

pycotech.utils.map_channels(fn: Union[str, pathlib.Path]) → Dict[str, List[str]][source]Â¶

Parses metadata in the .PLW file to build mapping between acquisition devices and associated channels. Devices and channels are mapped in same order as acquisition.

Parameters

fn â€“ path to the .PLW file to parse.

Returns

dictionary mapping the serial of each acquisition device to the labels of its associated channels.

pycotech.utils.show_plot(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, ax: Optional[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes] = None) → matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes[source]Â¶

Plots values sampled from the acquisition devices over time.

Parameters

  • df â€“ can either be a dataframe (where each column contains values from a single channel) or a pico-stream (where the first column has channel labels, and the second column has associated measurement values).

  • ax â€“ axes onto which to render plots

Returns

updated plot axes.

pycotech.utils.to_pico_stream(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]Â¶

Flattens a PicoLog PLW Player data dataframe to a virtual data-stream - simulating sequential acquisition of data channel-by-channel.

For an input dataframe of shape (num_samples, num_channels), the output data-stream will have length num_samples x num_channels.

Parameters

df â€“ PicoLog PLW Player dataframe, where each row has temperature measurements across PicoLogger acquisition channels.

Returns

Equivalent flattened data-stream dataframe, where each row has a temperature measurement from a single PicoLogger acquisition channel.

index: None (enumeration of entries) columns: channel, temp

Saves the input dataframe to .TXT - mimicking the data format used by PicoLog PLW Player.

Parameters

  • df â€“ dataframe to save.

  • fn â€“ path to output .TXT file.
